marketNews.title: BEI Director States Immediate Implementation of Broker Code and Domicile Opening
marketNews.content: BEI Director, Irvan Susandy, stated on Monday (5/5) that they will immediately implement the opening of broker codes and domiciles, although he did not elaborate further. Irvan mentioned that the opening of broker codes and domiciles will be done non-real-time, with data being sent during the post-first trading session break. Currently, Irvan explained that this plan is still in the development stage because there are changes occurring in the BEI system.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Residential Property Price Survey Shows Slowdown in Residential Property Price Growth
marketNews.content: The residential property price survey from Bank Indonesia indicates that residential property price growth slowed down to +1.07% YoY in 1Q25 (vs. 1Q24: +1.89% YoY, 4Q24: +1.39% YoY), marking the weakest growth since 3Q21. Meanwhile, residential property sales in 1Q25 grew +0.73% YoY (vs. 1Q24: +31.16% YoY, 4Q24: -15.09% YoY), supported by sales growth in the small-type house segment of +21.75% YoY (vs. 1Q24: +37.84% YoY, 4Q24: -23.7% YoY) amidst a contraction in sales for the medium-type segment of -35.76% YoY (vs. 1Q24: +13.57% YoY, 4Q24: -16.61% YoY) and the large-type segment of -11.69% YoY (vs. 1Q24: +48.51% YoY, 4Q24: +20.44% YoY).

marketNews.title: BPI Danantara and Eramet SA in Talks to Acquire Zhejiang Huayou Cobalt's HPAL Smelter in Weda Bay
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that BPI Danantara and Eramet SA are in discussions to form a partnership to acquire the HPAL smelter owned by Zhejiang Huayou Cobalt Co. located in the Weda Bay Industrial Park. If realized, this would be the first major transaction since BPI Danantara was formed. Bloomberg sources stated that stakeholders hope to sign a memorandum of understanding by the end of May 2025, but warned that discussions are ongoing and plans may change. An Eramet spokesperson confirmed they are discussing with Danantara, while Huayou Cobalt declined to comment and BPI Danantara has not yet responded to the issue.

marketNews.title: CATL Seeks $1 Billion Loan for Indonesia Plant Expansion
marketNews.content: Bloomberg reported that electric vehicle battery manufacturer, Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. (CATL), is seeking a loan of around 1 billion US dollars to finance its investment in Indonesia. Bloomberg sources mentioned that the funds will be used to finance its joint venture with Indonesia Battery Corporation to build a battery cell plant in Karawang, West Java.

marketNews.title: Gas Supply Realization Remains Below HGBT Incentive Allocation Threshold
marketNews.content: The Chairman of the Gas Users Industry Forum, Yustinus Gunawan, stated on Monday (5/5) that gas supply realization is still far below the specific gas price incentive (HGBT) allocation, with January 2025 realization only at 54%. Yustinus said that excess usage will be subject to a regasification tariff of 16.77 US dollars per MMBtu. Yustinus also mentioned that the overpayment in January 2025 has not yet been compensated by Perusahaan Gas Negara ($PGAS) and other gas distribution business entities. Allocated Industrial Gas (AGIT) only reached 73% in February 2025 and 76% in March 2025, according to Yustinus.

marketNews.title: President Prabowo to Meet Bill Gates on Wednesday (7/5) Regarding Social Program Support
marketNews.content: President Prabowo Subianto stated on Monday (5/5) that he will meet Bill Gates on Wednesday (7/5), where President Prabowo claimed that Gates offered support for social programs in Indonesia. Prabowo explained that he did not yet know the form of assistance Gates would offer, but President Prabowo reiterated that his government will continue to focus on the free nutritious meal program.

marketNews.title: Government Allocates IDR 268 Trillion for Free Nutritious Meal Program in 2026, a 57% YoY Increase
marketNews.content: The Director of State Budget Compilation at the Ministry of Finance, Rofyanto Kurniawan, stated on Monday (5/5) that the government will allocate a budget for the free nutritious meal program amounting to 268 trillion rupiah in 2026, an increase of about +57% YoY from the 2025 State Budget allocation of 171 trillion rupiah. Rofyanto mentioned that after the target number of recipients in 2025, which was 82.9 million people, is achieved, the government's main focus will shift to improving the quality of program implementation. In his presentation, the free nutritious meal program is expected to contribute 1.03% to 2026 GDP, create more than 1.32 million jobs, and help reduce the poverty rate by 0.38 percentage points.

marketNews.title: Motto on Self-Improvement and Perseverance
marketNews.content: "Don't be like that. Focus on yourself. Upgrade. Learn. Evaluate. Be consistent. Be patient." - lukmanicc

tickerNews.title: EXCL 1Q25 Net Profit -29% YoY, Below Expectations
tickerNews.content: XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera ($EXCL) has announced its financial performance for 1Q25 - which is the performance of XL Axiata before merging with Smartfren Telecom - with a net profit of 385 billion rupiah (-29% YoY, -23% QoQ). This result is below expectations (17% of the 2025F consensus estimate). Operationally, EXCL recorded 58.9 million mobile customers in 1Q25 (+2.3% YoY, +0.2% QoQ), with the average revenue per user (ARPU) declining to 40 thousand rupiah (-9% YoY, -2% QoQ). EXCL management stated in an earnings call on Tuesday (6/5) that excluding revenue from the fixed broadband business (First Media) which was only reflected in the financial statements at the end of 2024, the company's revenue actually decreased by -5% YoY in 1Q25. EXCL management explained that the decline in ARPU in 1Q25 was caused by weakening purchasing power and tighter competition due to competitors selling starter packs at cheaper prices. Nevertheless, management sees that the intensity of competition among operators is starting to subside and is expected to reflect positively starting in 2H25. In line with the merger which was just completed on April 16, 2025, EXCL management is still in the operational integration phase and therefore cannot provide guidance for 2025. However, management expects merger cost synergy to reach 100 million US dollars this year. Management will also anticipate a slight increase in expenses and capex at the beginning of the integration process, before they are expected to decrease in the long run. In the earnings calls of Telkom Indonesia ($TLKM), Indosat ($ISAT), and EXCL, management each stated that the intensity of competition among operators is starting to subside and is expected to be reflected positively in 2H25. We assess that the potential subsiding of competition among operators is based on the declining ARPU trend, where TLKM continues to drop closer to the psychological level of 40 thousand rupiah (1Q25: 42.4 thousand rupiah, 4Q24: 44 thousand rupiah) and EXCL has reached 40 thousand rupiah. Furthermore, the continuous decline in data yield will damage the profitability of all industry players going forward. Specifically for EXCL, the 2Q25 performance release will be the new base of the merged entity, so the company's future performance will be assessed using that figure.

tickerNews.title: HRTA 1Q25 Net Profit +46% YoY, In Line with Guidance
tickerNews.content: HRTA: Hartadinata Abadi recorded a net profit of 150 billion rupiah in 1Q25 (+6.8% QoQ, +46% YoY), in line with the 2025 guidance from management which targets growth of approximately +40-50% YoY. The quarterly increase in net profit was driven by a revenue increase of +38% QoQ. However, the increase in cost of goods sold (+39% QoQ) and operating expenses (+78% QoQ) caused the operating profit margin to drop -120 bps QoQ to 4.1%.

tickerNews.title: MIDI Targets Minimum High-Single Digit Revenue Growth in 2025, Allocates IDR 1.5 Trillion Capex
tickerNews.content: Midi Utama Indonesia management stated during the 1Q25 earnings call on Tuesday (6/5) that the company is targeting minimum high-single digit revenue growth throughout 2025 (vs. 2024 realization: +15% YoY), with a minimum mid-single digit SSSG target (vs. 2024 realization: +9.86% YoY). To achieve this target, MIDI is allocating a capex of 1.5 trillion rupiah throughout 2025 (vs. 2024 realization: 1.5 trillion rupiah). This fund is intended to open 200 new outlets during 2025 (vs. 2024 realization: 203 outlets) focusing on areas outside Java, and the relocation of 1 operational warehouse in June 2025. MIDI management also mentioned that the dividend payout ratio for the 2024 fiscal year will be higher compared to the 2023 fiscal year, which reached 30%, implying a minimum dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of 4.92 rupiah per share with an indicative dividend yield of 1.2% as of Tuesday (6/5).

tickerNews.title: MTLA Records Marketing Sales of IDR 500 Billion in 1Q25, 25% of 2025 Target
tickerNews.content: Metropolitan Land Director, Olivia Surodjo, stated that the company recorded marketing sales amounting to 500 billion rupiah during 1Q25 (+14.2% YoY), equivalent to 25% of the 2025 target of 2 trillion rupiah.

tickerNews.title: SKRN to Distribute 2024 Book Year Dividend of ~IDR 285 Billion (IDR 40/share) with 8.6% Yield
tickerNews.content: Superkrane Mitra Utama will distribute dividends for the 2024 book year amounting to ~285 billion rupiah or 40 rupiah per share, equivalent to a ~129% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 8.6% as of Tuesday (6/5). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is May 14, 2025, while payment will be on May 28, 2025.

tickerNews.title: RAJA to Distribute 2024 Book Year Dividend of ~IDR 254 Billion (IDR 60/share) with 2.7% Yield
tickerNews.content: Rukun Raharja will distribute dividends for the 2024 book year amounting to ~254 billion rupiah or 60 rupiah per share, equivalent to a ~59% dividend payout ratio and indicating a dividend yield of 2.7% as of Tuesday (6/5). The cum date in the regular and negotiation market is May 9, 2025, while payment will be on June 4, 2025.

tickerNews.title: KKGI Commissioner Sold ~12.1 Million Shares for ~IDR 4.5 Billion
tickerNews.content: Resource Alam Indonesia Commissioner, Leong See Mun, sold ~12.1 million KKGI shares at an average price of ~375 rupiah per share on May 2-5, 2025. The total transaction value reached ~4.5 billion rupiah. Following this transaction, Leong See Mun's ownership in KKGI decreased from 0.53% to 0.28%.

tickerNews.title: GIAA Explains Delay in 15 Aircraft Operations Due to Routine Maintenance Backlog, Citing Global Supply Chain Crisis
tickerNews.content: Garuda Indonesia Director, Rahmat Hanafi, told Kontan on Tuesday (6/5) that currently there are 15 aircraft units awaiting scheduled routine maintenance, consisting of 14 units of PT Citilink aircraft and 1 unit of GIAA aircraft. Previously, Bloomberg reported over the weekend that GIAA had halted operations of at least 15 aircraft units due to difficulties in making maintenance payments. On the other hand, Rahmat claimed to Kontan that this issue was caused by the global crisis in the aircraft spare parts supply chain.

tickerNews.title: BLES Targets Double-Digit Revenue Growth in 2025, New Factory to Boost Capacity
tickerNews.content: Superior Prima Sukses Director, Andrew, stated that the company is targeting double-digit revenue growth throughout 2025. To support this target, the company will soon operate a new factory in Banjarnegara, Central Java in the middle of this year. With this expansion, the total AAC block production capacity will increase from 4.61 million cubic meters per year to 5.6 million cubic meters per year.

tickerNews.title: MCAS: Bank of Singapore Increased Ownership to 9.47% After Acquiring 25.8 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: M Cash Integrasi announced that Bank of Singapore has increased its ownership by 25.8 million MCAS shares. The price and transaction date were not mentioned, where this transaction was only recorded in KSEI data as of May 2, 2025. After this transaction, Bank of Singapore's ownership in MCAS increased from 6.49% to 9.47%.

tickerNews.title: BPII Reduced Ownership in MTWI to 85.9% After Selling ~28.4 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Malacca Trust Wuwungan Insurance shareholder, Batavia Prosperindo Internasional ($BPII) sold ~28.4 million MTWI shares at an average price of 137.5 rupiah per share. The total transaction reached ~3.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, BPII's ownership in MTWI decreased from 86.86% to 85.9%.

tickerNews.title: VKTR Wins Tender for 80 Locally Assembled Electric Buses from Transjakarta
tickerNews.content: VKTR Teknologi Mobilitas ($VKTR) won the tender for ordering 80 units of locally assembled electric buses (completely knocked down/CKD) from PT Transportasi Jakarta (Transjakarta), with an undisclosed transaction value. With this order, VKTR has supplied 152 units of electric buses in the Transjakarta network.
